messages.content:
read url query parameter 'id' defaults to 'DENW49AL00009XTV' and requests a gltf 3D model form https://api.syte.ms/api/3d/gltf/{id}. Create a webvr a-frame app that displays this 3D model placing it in a green floor and add a blue sky.
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Certainly! Below is a self-contained HTML file that creates a simple WebVR app using A-Frame to display a GLTF 3D model from a URL with the specified default query parameter. The model will be placed on a green floor, and there will be a blue sky. ```html 3D Model Viewer
Use the WASD keys to move and mouse to look around.
``` ### Instructions to Use 1. Copy the entire code snippet above into a new file and save it with a `.html` extension, e.g., `3d_model_viewer.html`. 2. Open the HTML file in a web browser that supports WebVR/WebXR. 3. If you would like to test with a different model, you can add an `id` query parameter to the URL, like this: `3d_model_viewer.html?id=YOUR_MODEL_ID`. ### Controls - Use WASD keys to move around. - Use your mouse (or VR controller, if available) to look around. This simple example sets up a basic 3D environment displaying the specified GLTF model on a green floor with a blue sky.
